bug.author: MarcCote
bug.summary: Does `add_embedding` support word embedding with metadata that has an header?
bug.description: When I try to use for my word embeddings the following assertion is raised: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lanpa/tensorboard-pytorch/blob/master/tensorboardX/writer.py#L445>"#labels should equal with #data points"</denchmark-link> . However, according to <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/embedding#metadata>tensorboard documentation</denchmark-link> the metadata can have one additional row: the header. As a test, I've commented out line 445 and it works without any issue. I was able to visualize my word embeddings in Tensorboard.

comments.comment: Hi, my code is based on the assumption in tensorboard doc: If the TSV metadata file has only a single column, then we donâ€™t expect a header row, and assume each row is the label of the embedding. We include this exception because it matches the commonly-used "vocab file" format. Maybe your header message is hiding in your visualization lol.
